publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-4765 Chris Ballance: An Ethical Policy for Scotland—That the Parliament asks the Scottish Executive to acknowledge that, as Scotland increasingly becomes an actor on the world stage, it has a moral responsibility to engage ethically with other countries and to defend human rights abroad as well as at home.

S2M-4765 Chris Ballance: An Ethical Policy for Scotland—That the Parliament asks the Scottish Executive to acknowledge that, as Scotland increasingly becomes an actor on the world stage, it has a moral responsibility to engage ethically with other countries and to defend human rights abroad as well as at home. Supported by: Eleanor Scott*, Patrick Harvie*, Mark Ballard*, Shiona Baird*
S2M-4765 An Ethical Policy for Scotland (lodged on 7 September 2006) Tommy Sheridan*, Robin Harper*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*
S2M-4765 An Ethical Policy for Scotland (lodged on 7 September 2006) Donald Gorrie*
S2M-4765 An Ethical Policy for Scotland (lodged on 7 September 2006) Carolyn Leckie*
S2M-4765 An Ethical Policy for Scotland (lodged on 7 September 2006) Dr Jean Turner*
